words.definition: as appears or is stated to be true, though not necessarily so, different from apparently slightly
words.usage: The party secretary resigned, ostensibly from ill health

words.definition: unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
words.usage: The purchaser should avoid asking for superfluous information.

words.definition: (1) very careful about the accuracy and details. (2) very concerned about cleanliness.
words.usage: there might be a certain fastidious courtesy in dying without a trace.
her voice was low but vehement.

words.definition: To say unfairly that sb is responsible for sth.
words.usage: my employer was imputing to me.

words.definition: eager, quick to argue or fight
